bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Juan D. Castro, August 28, 1940

div1.p: Hench poses various questions concerning Las Animas Hospital.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Juan D. Castro, August 28, 1940
div1.opener:
Copy to Moran.
August 28, 1940
Dr. Juan D. Castro
Las Animas Hospital
Havana, Cuba
My dear Doctor Castro:
div1.p:
I have been pursuing my historical researches on the con-
quest of yellow fever and have gotten considerable memoranda together in prepara-
tion to submit to His Excellency, Dr. Ramos, what evidence I have collected to
indicate the true site of Camp Lazear. I am sending also some of this information
to Dr. Albertini, as I am sure he will be interested in it. May I impose upon
your generosity to ask you for some help and information? Has the history of
Las Animas Hospital ever been written up in any booklet or article in any medical
or other Cuban journal and if so, would it be possible for me to obtain a copy?
Has the hospital been materially changed in the last forty years, since the time
when yellow fever work was done there? You remember that through your good
offices I was permitted to taken photographs of the room in which Miss Maass
died and in which presumably Dr. Lazear was bitten. I have been unable to obtain
a general photograph of the buildings of the Las Animas Hospital. Do you know
whether any air plane photographs of the hospital buildings and grounds has ever
been taken or whether in connection with the literature of the hospital, any
drawing of the general lay-out at the Las Animas Hospital has ever been made?
I am very anxious to obtain such a photograph or drawing, not only to have a
slide made of it but also to use it in connection with my papers on the conquest
of yellow fever.

Agramonte did his work at first in “Military Hospital No. 1”
which I was led to believe was formerly “Hospital Alfonso XIII”. I am anxious
to find out whether this is so and when the Military Hospital No. 1 was replaced.
I understand the General Calixto Garcia Hospital is now on the site of the old
Military Hospital No. 1. Is that true? I have written to the Superintendent of
the General Calixto Garcia Hospital, asking for this information, but as I do not
know anyone at that hospital, I merely addressed it to the Superintendent. May I
take the liberty of asking what you know about this and perhaps if I do not hear
from the superintendent, you could give me the name of someone there who could
give me this information.

closer.seg:
P.S. Would you care to receive with my compliments the weekly
Proceedings of the Mayo Clinic Staff Meetings?
